children.text: There are proprietary BAL weephole covers that have not been removed from the brickwork around this dwelling, which will not allow the brick cavities to drain.
The relevant Australian Standard, AS 4773 - Masonry for Small Buildings requires in clause 10.5.3 Flashings and Weepholes, that
‘Cavity flashing shall be drained by weepholes at 1200mm maximum centres’ .
The builder must remove these covers to allow the cavities to drain in accordance with above.
